name: Abhi Shelat
content: I am a Professor at the Khoury College of Computer Sciences at Northeastern. My research area is computer security and cryptography. My work currently focuses on secure computation protocols, zero-knowledge protocols and verifiable computation. My email is abhi at neu.edu. Students Current members in my group are: LaKyah Tyner (started 2021) My former PhD students include Mona Sergi (2013, now at Google), Chih-hao Shen (2014, now at Google), Ben Kreuter (2018, now at Google), Yash Kondi (2022, postdoc at Aarhus, researcher at Silence labs), Jack Doerner (2022, postdoc at Technion and Brown, assistant professor at U. of Virginia), and Eysa Lee (2023, assistant professor at Barnard). Former post-doc and then research scientist Ran Cohen is now an assistant professor at IDC Herzliya. Recent talks “The modern anonymous credential”, Simons Institute at Berkeley, August 2025. I had so much fun giving this talk! 15m talk on anonymous credentials at Real World Crypto (RWC2025) So rushed, and so much to say. Research My research is supported by the National Science Foundation and several generous grants from companies like Microsoft, Google, Brave, and Meta.
